channel.title: C#
channel.description: Does anyone know of an IDE for C# and C++? I'm starting to learn a bit of C#

item.title: C#
item.dc:creator: @PLayRooney PLayRooney
item.description:
@PLayRooney wrote:

I am now using microsoft visual C#, Thanks guys.

Read full topic

item.title: C#
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

C#: Microsoft Visual C# – No contest. (Unless you’re on linux then you really only have MonoDevelop)

C++: If you plan on doing windows programming, Microsoft Visual C++ it has great intellisense, if you wanna do more cross platform shit (or if you’re on linux) go with CodeBlocks

Read full topic

item.title: C#
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Alphaspida, post:12, topic:391044”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=486994.msg3572094#msg3572094 date=1303132662]

I actually don’t understand why nobody uses mac. I mean, there is a game for it!

Photoshop.

I have hackintosh (mac with all of its protection removed, so it can be installed on any pc) installed, I would still prefer linux over it though. Only thing I got the MacOSX for was mainly kicks.
[/quote]

Don’t you have to have to have specific hardware for installations of mac to run on it?

Last I looked it was only for certain intel systems.[/quote]
Intel or AMD with hackintosh. I think there were patches for other things, but no guarentee.

Read full topic

item.title: C#
item.dc:creator: @Alphaspida Alphaspida
item.description:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:10, topic:391044”][quote author=someone2 link=topic=486994.msg3571911#msg3571911 date=1303105866]
I actually don’t understand why nobody uses mac. I mean, there is a game for it!

Photoshop.
[/quote]
I have hackintosh (mac with all of its protection removed, so it can be installed on any pc) installed, I would still prefer linux over it though. Only thing I got the MacOSX for was mainly kicks.[/quote]

Don’t you have to have to have specific hardware for installations of mac to run on it?

Last I looked it was only for certain intel systems.

item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

I would love a Mac, they’re just so fucking expensive and when I can get a perfectly good PC for around £450, I don’t see the point.

Topic: SharpDevelop is a nice alternative, only it doesn’t support C++.
